column4: hi! I have Ubuntu Drapper installed and my wireless card shows up in the networking app. Yet I'm not able to connect to the local wireless router
what did you use to attempt to connect?
and is your wireless router using WEP or WPA or no encryption?
there is no encryption
ok, open a terminal and type "sudo iwlist scanning" and tell me if it sees your wireless router there
hmm....ok, i guess there's still some problem with drivers or something
what type of wireless device?
so what? install ndiswrapper?
I'm not sure
ohhh....broadcom.  this should be interesting ;)
ok, hold on, let me find some URLs on ubuntuforums.org for you
its an inspiron 1150 laptop
i think all we need to know is that it's a broadcom 4306
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=201902&highlight=broadcom+4306
that seems to be for your wireless adapter
unfortunately this type of wireless adapter seems to take more effort than others
yeah I'm used to ndiswraper...its all I ever used
if everything's working, you should be able to see the card in iwconfig and you should be able to scan with iwlist
ok...right now I'm using the eth0 connection
thanks for your help earlier
but I can't seem to find the broadcom 4306 driver anywhere online and dell doesn't have it on there site
